EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAMS:

The Plant maintains a written emergency response plan, which provides essential planning and training for protecting workers, the public, and the environment during emergency situations. 

The Industrial Park owner, The Dow Chemical Company Texas Operations (Dow), leads the execution of all emergency response activities.  The Plant's written emergency plan is integrated with Dow's plan, and all external communications are coordinated in accordance with our written plan; Dow manages alerts to the community through the CAER Hotline. 

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

Braskem believes in the philosophy of continuous improvement. A number of programs are in place to monitor the status of ongoing efforts and identify opportunities for improvement.  The Oyster Creek Plant maintains a structured safety process, as well as employee safety teams that meet regularly.

The Plant has not identified any changes to safety practices necessary to achieve or maintain compliance with any applicable regulatory standard since our last submission.  However, as part of our efforts to continually improve safety at the Plant, Braskem is currently training site personnel on Human Reliability to increase focus on higher risk tasks and effective problem-solving across all work groups.

Braskem actively encourages participation by all its employees in process safety management and provides relevant process safety information and procedures to all employees. Employees participate in PHA revalidation studies and PHA studies triggered through our Management of Change Program.  We engage experienced employees to develop and administer our training programs.  Our employees and contractors are well trained, and they actively participate in the investigation of any incidents or accidents.  We also encourage employee suggestions for process safety improvement, and we regularly implement enhancements based on these suggestions.

Our Mechanical Integrity Program includes written procedures governing the inspection and maintenance of affected process equipment. As prescribed by our Management of Change Procedure, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews are designed to ensure safe process operations following any new installations or modifications. The Plant has also developed and implemented a Hot Work Permit Procedure to prevent performance of hot work in potentially dangerous areas.

Through implementation of these multiple elements of our prevention program, the Plant minimizes accidental chemical releases. In order to enhance and reinforce the Plant and employee commitment to the standard underlying these management systems, the Company has established both specific accountability and controls for implementation of these systems in support of the Plant's high standards for accident prevention.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

At the Oyster Creek Plant, we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes in a safe and responsible manner. We use a combination of accidental release prevention programs and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as protection of the environment. This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that we have designed and implemented, including:

* A description of the Oyster Creek Plant and use of substances regulated by EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) regulation
* An overview of our accidental release prevention programs
* A five-year accident history for accidental releases of chemicals regulated by EPA's RMP rule
* An overview of our emergency response program
* An overview of improvements made at the Oyster Creek Plant to minimize the potential for accidental chemical releases that could adversely affect our employees, the public, and the environment
* Certifications in accordance with RMP rule
* Relevant details about the Oyster Creek Plant's risk management program

FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

The Oyster Creek Plant includes operations to produce polypropylene using a variety of chemicals including RMP regulated substances. 

Our accidental release prevention programs and our contingency planning efforts help us effectively manage potential hazards these chemicals pose to our employees, the public, and the environment if mishandled.
